## ğŸ“° Hacker News Highlights / é»‘å®¢æ–°é—»ç²¾é€‰

### LinkedIn Identity Verification: What You Actually Surrendered

* LinkedIn verification redirects to Persona Identities Inc., a San Francisco-based third-party company that collects extensive personal data
* Data collected includes passport details, selfie, facial geometry biometrics, NFC chip data, national ID, behavioral patterns (hesitation/copy-paste detection), and device fingerprints
* Persona cross-references your data against government databases, credit agencies, utility companies, and mobile providersâ€”essentially running a background check
* Your passport images and selfies are used as AI training data under "legitimate interest" legal basis, not explicit consent
* 17 subprocessors handle your data: Anthropic, OpenAI, and Groqcloud perform "data extraction and analysis" on your government ID
* All 17 subprocessors are US/Canada-based (16 US, 1 Canada, 0 EU), despite serving European users
* US CLOUD Act allows American law enforcement to access your data regardless of physical server location (even if stored in Germany)
* EU-US Data Privacy Framework protection is legally fragileâ€”built on an Executive Order that can be revoked, already facing legal challenges
* Biometric facial geometry data is permanent and irreversibleâ€”unlike passwords, you can't change your face if compromised
* Data sharing includes LinkedIn, service providers, data partners, affiliates, potential acquirers, and law enforcement (including national security requests with gag orders)

### F-Droid Weekly Update: Keep Android Open Campaign & App Updates

* **Google's Android lockdown still proceeding** - Despite public perception that Google canceled restrictive plans, the August-announced changes are still scheduled; F-Droid launches banner campaign to raise awareness
* **F-Droid Basic 2.0-alpha3 released** - New features include CSV export of installed apps, install history, mirror chooser, screenshot prevention, and Material Design 3 compliance
* **Major app updates** - Conversations/Quicksy (2.19.10) removes Google library dependencies via IPC; Dolphin Emulator (2512) with extensive changelog; ProtonVPN (5.15.70.0) drops OpenVPN, reducing size by 40%
* **Nextcloud ecosystem updates** - Multiple apps updated including main client (33.0.0), Notes, Talk (23.0.0); server-side Hub 26 Winter released with new features
* **Notable updates** - Image Toolbox (3.6.1) adds AI tools; Luanti (5.15.1) fixes flickering; QUIK SMS (4.3.4) resolves message deletion bug; SimpleEmail (1.5.4) returns after 2-year hiatus
* **Repository changes** - 5 apps removed (including Tomdroid, Tibetan Keyboard); 1 new app added (NeoDB You); 287 total apps updated this week

**[Read Original / é˜…è¯»åŸæ–‡](https://f-droid.org/2026/02/20/twif.html)**

### sandbox-exec: macOS's Hidden Command-Line Sandboxing Tool

* `sandbox-exec` is a built-in macOS CLI utility for running applications in isolated, restricted environments with explicit permission controls
* Sandboxing provides security benefits: protects against malicious code, limits damage from compromised apps, controls privacy, and creates testing environments
* Sandbox profiles use Scheme-like (LISP) syntax with two approaches: deny-by-default (most secure) or allow-by-default (more permissive)
* Basic syntax: `sandbox-exec -f profile.sb command_to_run` where profile.sb defines access rules using literal paths, regex, or glob patterns
* Practical uses include creating network-isolated terminal sessions, leveraging pre-built system profiles in `/System/Library/Sandbox/Profiles`
* Debug sandbox violations using Console.app or real-time terminal logs: `log stream --style compact --predicate 'sender=="Sandbox"'`
* Advanced techniques: create shell aliases for common profiles, import and extend existing profiles with additional restrictions
* Limitations: Apple-deprecated (favors App Sandbox), complex apps require extensive testing, no GUI, trial-and-error profile creation
* Despite deprecation, offers unmatched flexibility for custom security profiles tailored to specific applications and use cases

### sandbox-exec:macOS é²œä¸ºäººçŸ¥çš„å‘½ä»¤è¡Œæ²™ç›’å·¥å…·

* `sandbox-exec` æ˜¯ macOS å†…ç½®çš„å‘½ä»¤è¡Œå·¥å…·,ç”¨äºåœ¨éš”ç¦»å—é™ç¯å¢ƒä¸­è¿è¡Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åº,å¹¶æä¾›æ˜¾å¼æƒé™æ§åˆ¶

### PentAGI - Fully Autonomous AI-Powered Penetration Testing System

* An innovative automated security testing platform that uses AI agents to autonomously conduct penetration tests, combining 20+ professional security tools (nmap, metasploit, sqlmap) with multi-agent orchestration in isolated Docker environments
* Key features include fully autonomous operation with specialized AI agents (researcher, developer, executor), smart memory system with knowledge graph integration (Neo4j), comprehensive monitoring (Grafana/Prometheus/Jaeger), web intelligence gathering, and support for multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama, AWS Bedrock, Gemini, DeepSeek, etc.)
* Notable for being a self-hosted, production-ready solution that bridges AI and cybersecurity - it's gaining traction (2,107 stars today) as one of the first truly autonomous pentesting systems with enterprise-grade architecture, offering security professionals a scalable microservices platform with persistent storage, detailed reporting, and real-time observability

### GitNexus - Code Intelligence Engine for AI Agents

* Transforms any codebase into a knowledge graph that maps dependencies, call chains, clusters, and execution flows â€” giving AI agents complete architectural awareness to prevent missed dependencies and broken changes
* Dual deployment: CLI + MCP server for production use with Cursor/Claude Code/Windsurf, or browser-based Web UI for quick exploration without installation
* Exposes 7 MCP tools (hybrid search, symbol context, impact analysis, change detection, coordinated rename, Cypher queries) plus resources and prompts that let even smaller models compete with larger ones through deep structural understanding

### Superpowers - An Agentic Skills Framework for AI Coding Agents

* **What it does**: A complete software development workflow system that transforms AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Codex, OpenCode) into disciplined developers. Instead of jumping straight into code, agents first clarify requirements, create digestible specs, build detailed implementation plans, then execute through subagent-driven development with autonomous work sessions lasting up to 2 hours.

* **Key features**: 
  - Composable skills library covering brainstorming, TDD (RED-GREEN-REFACTOR), systematic debugging, git worktrees, code review, and subagent orchestration
  - Enforces best practices: test-first development, YAGNI, DRY principles
  - Automatic skill triggering - agents know when to use each workflow
  - Multi-platform support via plugin marketplaces (Claude Code, Cursor) or manual setup (Codex, OpenCode)
  - Parallel development with subagent dispatching and two-stage review (spec compliance + code quality)

* **Why it's notable**: Gained 769 stars today by solving a critical problem in AI-assisted development - preventing agents from writing untested, poorly-planned code. It's a methodology that actually works in production, turning chaotic AI coding into structured engineering. The framework is extensible (you can write custom skills) and emphasizes evidence over claims with systematic verification at every step.

---

## ğŸš€ Fast-Moving Repos / å¿«é€Ÿå´›èµ·é¡¹ç›®

### visual-explainer - Agent Skill for Beautiful HTML Visualizations

* Transforms terminal output (diffs, architecture diagrams, data tables) into styled, self-contained HTML pages with dark/light themes and interactive Mermaid diagrams
* Key features: 5 slash commands (`/diff-review`, `/plan-review`, `/project-recap`, `/fact-check`, `/generate-web-diagram`), automatic table rendering for complex data, supports 11 diagram types, zero build dependencies
* Why it's notable: Solves the "ugly ASCII art" problem that plagues coding agentsâ€”generates presentation-ready visualizations with real typography, Chart.js dashboards, and zoom/pan interactions. Works with Pi, Claude Code, and other agents following the Agent Skills spec. 2,110 stars for making agent output actually readable.

---

### visual-explainer - ä¸º AI ä»£ç†ç”Ÿæˆç²¾ç¾ HTML å¯è§†åŒ–çš„æŠ€èƒ½æ’ä»¶

* åŠŸèƒ½ä»‹ç»:å°†ç»ˆç«¯è¾“å‡º(ä»£ç å·®å¼‚ã€æ¶æ„å›¾ã€æ•°æ®è¡¨)è½¬æ¢ä¸ºå¸¦æ·±è‰²/æµ…è‰²ä¸»é¢˜å’Œäº¤äº’å¼ Mermaid å›¾è¡¨çš„ç‹¬ç«‹ HTML é¡µé¢
* ä¸»è¦ç‰¹ç‚¹:æä¾› 5 ä¸ªæ–œæ å‘½ä»¤(`/diff-review`ã€`/plan-review`ã€`/project-recap`ã€`/fact-check`ã€`/generate-web-diagram`),è‡ªåŠ¨æ¸²æŸ“å¤æ‚è¡¨æ ¼,æ”¯æŒ 11 ç§å›¾è¡¨ç±»å‹,æ— éœ€æ„å»ºä¾èµ–
* ä¸ºä½•å€¼å¾—å…³æ³¨:è§£å†³äº† AI ä»£ç†è¾“å‡º"ä¸‘é™‹ ASCII è‰ºæœ¯"çš„ç—›ç‚¹â€”â€”ç”Ÿæˆå¯ç”¨äºæ¼”ç¤ºçš„å¯è§†åŒ–å†…å®¹,åŒ…å«çœŸå®æ’ç‰ˆã€Chart.js ä»ªè¡¨æ¿å’Œç¼©æ”¾/å¹³ç§»äº¤äº’ã€‚å…¼å®¹ Piã€Claude Code ç­‰éµå¾ª Agent Skills è§„èŒƒçš„ä»£ç†ã€‚2,110 æ˜Ÿæ ‡,è®©ä»£ç†è¾“å‡ºçœŸæ­£å¯è¯»ã€‚

**[View Repository / æŸ¥çœ‹ä»“åº“](https://github.com/nicobailon/visual-explainer)**

### NullClaw - Ultra-lightweight autonomous AI assistant infrastructure in pure Zig

* **What it does**: A fully autonomous AI assistant runtime that compiles to a 678 KB static binary, consuming only ~1 MB RAM and booting in under 2 ms. Runs on $5 hardware including ARM SBCs, microcontrollers, and edge devices.

* **Key features**: 
  * Extreme efficiency: 678 KB binary size with <2 ms startup time on Apple Silicon, <8 ms on 0.8 GHz edge cores
  * 22+ AI provider integrations (OpenRouter, Anthropic, OpenAI, Ollama, Groq, DeepSeek, etc.) with OpenAI-compatible API support
  * 13 communication channels (Telegram, Discord, Slack, iMessage, Matrix, WhatsApp, IRC, and more)
  * Hybrid memory system with SQLite-based vector search and FTS5 keyword search
  * Comprehensive security: sandboxing (Landlock, Firejail, Bubblewrap, Docker), encrypted secrets, pairing authentication, workspace scoping
  * Fully modular vtable-based architecture - swap any component (providers, channels, tools, memory, runtimes) via config
  * 18+ built-in tools including shell execution, file operations, browser control, hardware peripherals (Arduino, Raspberry Pi GPIO)
  * Cross-platform: ARM, x86, RISC-V with zero runtime dependencies beyond libc

* **Why it's notable**: NullClaw achieves what seemed impossible - a production-ready autonomous AI assistant that runs on $5 hardware. Written in Zig with zero garbage collection overhead, it outperforms TypeScript/Python/Go/Rust alternatives by orders of magnitude in binary size (10-40x smaller), memory usage (100-1000x less), and startup time. The vtable-based architecture provides enterprise-grade flexibility without bloat. With 2,843 tests and security-first design (encrypted secrets, multi-layer sandboxing, audit logging), it's suitable for edge deployment, IoT devices, and resource-constrained environments where traditional AI assistants can't run.

---

### NullClaw - ç”¨çº¯ Zig ç¼–å†™çš„è¶…è½»é‡çº§è‡ªä¸» AI åŠ©æ‰‹åŸºç¡€è®¾æ–½

* **ä¸ºä½•å€¼å¾—å…³æ³¨**: NullClaw å®ç°äº†çœ‹ä¼¼ä¸å¯èƒ½çš„ç›®æ ‡ - åœ¨ 5 ç¾å…ƒç¡¬ä»¶ä¸Šè¿è¡Œç”Ÿäº§çº§è‡ªä¸» AI åŠ©æ‰‹ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨ Zig ç¼–å†™,æ— åƒåœ¾å›æ”¶å¼€é”€,åœ¨äºŒè¿›åˆ¶å¤§å°(å° 10-40 å€)ã€å†…å­˜ä½¿ç”¨(å°‘ 100-1000 å€)å’Œå¯åŠ¨æ—¶é—´æ–¹é¢,æ€§èƒ½è¿œè¶… TypeScript/Python/Go/Rust æ›¿ä»£æ–¹æ¡ˆã€‚åŸºäº vtable çš„æ¶æ„åœ¨ä¸å¢åŠ è‡ƒè‚¿çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹æä¾›ä¼ä¸šçº§çµæ´»æ€§ã€‚æ‹¥æœ‰ 2,843 ä¸ªæµ‹è¯•å’Œå®‰å…¨ä¼˜å…ˆè®¾è®¡(åŠ å¯†å¯†é’¥ã€å¤šå±‚æ²™ç®±ã€å®¡è®¡æ—¥å¿—),é€‚ç”¨äºè¾¹ç¼˜éƒ¨ç½²ã€ç‰©è”ç½‘è®¾å¤‡å’Œä¼ ç»Ÿ AI åŠ©æ‰‹æ— æ³•è¿è¡Œçš„èµ„æºå—é™ç¯å¢ƒã€‚
